Description: Lock and version public API surfaces for identity, tasks, bids, runs, settlement, disputes, analytics, and webhooks.
Acceptance Criteria: OpenAPI and SDK contracts are version-tagged and diff checks fail on breaking changes

Description: Enforce idempotent semantics for run event settlement resolution, policy replay, and dispute transitions.
Acceptance Criteria: Duplicate request suites pass with stable responses and no ledger drift

Description: Promote trust/reputation aggregates to release-grade API with pagination, filters, and stable fields.
Acceptance Criteria: Trust graph endpoints return deterministic sorted payloads under pagination

Description: Add stronger dispute evidence validation and timeline correlation for ops and auditors.
Acceptance Criteria: Dispute evidence APIs enforce schema and hash-binding checks with test coverage

Summary: Run R1 regression and determinism matrix
Description: Execute and gate release on deterministic replay matrix across API, bundles, verify CLI, and fixture corpus.
Acceptance Criteria: Release candidate passes deterministic matrix twice with byte-stable outputs

Description: Generalize money-rail adapters for provider webhooks, retries, and lifecycle transition hooks.
Acceptance Criteria: Adapter contract supports create/status/cancel and transition callbacks with fixture tests

Description: Add one real payout provider integration in sandbox mode with deterministic state normalization.
Acceptance Criteria: Sandbox payouts can be created and confirmed through normalized operation states

Description: Ingest provider settlement files and compute deterministic mismatch artifacts by period and party.
Acceptance Criteria: Reconciliation worker emits mismatch records with stable IDs for identical inputs

Description: Expose mismatch list, classify, resolve, and export endpoints for finance operators.
Acceptance Criteria: Finance ops can resolve mismatches and replay the same resolution idempotently

Description: Define and implement alerts for payout failure rate, stale operations, and unresolved mismatch age.
Acceptance Criteria: Alerting dashboards and thresholds are live and validated in staging drills

Description: Define netting window artifact schema, closure semantics, and replay invariants.
Acceptance Criteria: Spec and schema for netting windows are merged with invariant mapping

Description: Compute per-party net obligations from escrow operations at configured deterministic intervals.
Acceptance Criteria: Netting worker emits deterministic net-close artifacts for repeat runs

Description: Create stress harness for hold/release/forfeit sequences and verify ledger conservation under load.
Acceptance Criteria: Stress tests complete with zero balance drift and deterministic operation ordering

Description: Publish net position and exposure APIs for operators and downstream settlement services.
Acceptance Criteria: Net position APIs return per-party balances and reconcile to netting artifacts

Summary: Enable staged rollout for netting windows
Description: Add tenant-level flags and rollback controls for gradual activation of netting logic.
Acceptance Criteria: Netting can be enabled per tenant and rolled back without data corruption

Description: Introduce arbiter identities, qualification flags, and deterministic assignment rules.
Acceptance Criteria: Arbiter assignment endpoint returns deterministic assignment given same candidate set

Description: Add open, evidence-link, hearing, and close transitions with immutable case traces.
Acceptance Criteria: Case lifecycle transitions enforce valid states and preserve append-only history

Description: Persist signed verdict and appeal artifacts linked to dispute evidence and policy hashes.
Acceptance Criteria: Verdict and appeal records validate against schema and signature checks

Description: Provide queue, SLA timers, and outcome reporting for arbitration operations.
Acceptance Criteria: Ops dashboard surfaces open cases, escalations, and case latency buckets

Description: Add conformance vectors for invalid transitions, signature failures, and appeal branching.
Acceptance Criteria: Conformance suite asserts expected pass/fail codes for arbitration edge cases

Description: Support draft, stage, promote, and rollback for settlement policy versions.
Acceptance Criteria: Policy versions can be staged/promoted/rolled back with immutable history

Description: Expose policy lifecycle controls, diff views, and blast-radius guardrails.
Acceptance Criteria: Operators can compare and promote policy versions with explicit confirmation flows

Description: Add acting-on-behalf token chains and enforcement in settlement and dispute endpoints.
Acceptance Criteria: Delegated calls include validated chain-of-authority with tenant-scoped constraints

Summary: Ship key rotation and revocation UX
Description: Enable organization key management, rotation ceremonies, and immediate revocation workflows.
Acceptance Criteria: Org admins can rotate and revoke keys with auditable events and no broken sessions

Summary: Add delegation and policy security tests
Description: Add adversarial tests for delegation abuse, stale keys, and policy rollout safety checks.
Acceptance Criteria: Security regression suite blocks unauthorized delegated actions and stale key use

Description: Specify plugin manifest, capability declarations, and certification metadata model.
Acceptance Criteria: Plugin contract docs and schemas validate manifests and compatibility declarations

Description: Create plugin publish/list/install APIs with signature and compatibility checks.
Acceptance Criteria: Registry accepts signed plugins and rejects incompatible or unsigned manifests

Description: Execute plugins in isolated runtime with CPU, memory, and syscall restrictions.
Acceptance Criteria: Sandbox enforces quotas and blocks disallowed system access in certification tests

Description: Add proof envelope that supports revealing only required evidence fields while preserving hash integrity.
Acceptance Criteria: Verifier accepts selective-disclosure bundles and fails tampered disclosures

Description: Run certification workflow for initial external plugin partners and publish compatibility matrix.
Acceptance Criteria: At least three partner plugins complete certification and appear in registry listing

Summary: Define R1 SLOs and error budgets
Description: Set SLOs for API availability, settlement latency, verification latency, and webhook delivery.
Acceptance Criteria: SLOs, SLIs, and alert thresholds are documented and wired to dashboards

Description: Add blocking CI checks for deterministic outputs, conformance, and critical-path end-to-end suites.
Acceptance Criteria: CI blocks merge on deterministic drift and critical e2e failures

Description: Exercise service failover and rollback playbooks for API, workers, and data stores.
Acceptance Criteria: Failover drills complete within defined RTO/RPO and are documented

Description: Benchmark transaction throughput and p95 latencies against release targets with reproducible scripts.
Acceptance Criteria: Benchmarks hit release p95 targets or produce prioritized remediation list

Description: Finalize on-call rotations, runbooks, incident taxonomy, and weekly reliability review cadence.
Acceptance Criteria: On-call schedule, escalation matrix, and postmortem template are active

Description: Publish turnkey SDK templates for JavaScript and Python that complete first verified transaction in under 30 minutes.
Acceptance Criteria: New account can run template and complete first verified run in docs-tested flow

Description: Provide webhook, Slack, and Zapier starter kits with deterministic payload contracts.
Acceptance Criteria: Starter kits deploy and pass integration smoke tests in CI

Description: Track onboarding funnel metrics from key generation through first paid settlement.
Acceptance Criteria: Funnel dashboard shows conversion rates for each onboarding step

Summary: Ship SDK reliability and compatibility suite
Description: Create contract tests that validate SDK behavior against API versions and error code stability.
Acceptance Criteria: SDK suites pass across supported versions and fail on contract-breaking changes

Summary: Publish R1 docs and migration guides
Description: Publish production docs, migration guides, and architecture examples for release adoption.
Acceptance Criteria: Docs site includes getting-started, migration, and troubleshooting flows reviewed by pilot users

Description: Finalize free, growth, and enterprise plan definitions with usage dimensions and overage behavior.
Acceptance Criteria: Pricing model approved with plan limits, overage policy, and margin targets

Description: Track billable events (verified runs, settlement volume, disputes) and enforce tenant plan quotas.
Acceptance Criteria: Usage counters and quota enforcement are accurate and audit-exportable

Summary: Ship billing and invoice export APIs
Description: Expose monthly usage invoices, line items, and finance export formats for customers.
Acceptance Criteria: Tenant billing APIs return invoice artifacts with deterministic line-item calculations

Description: Implement subscription checkout and renewal handling for growth plan customers.
Acceptance Criteria: Customers can subscribe, renew, and move between plans with billing events recorded

Description: Create dashboards for MRR, activation-to-paid conversion, churn, and gross margin by segment.
Acceptance Criteria: Weekly revenue scorecard auto-updates and is reviewed in operating cadence

Summary: Select pilot verticals and target accounts
Description: Choose two beachhead verticals and produce prioritized target account list with pain and budget scores.
Acceptance Criteria: Top 20 target accounts selected with segment rationale and contact strategy

Description: Define pilot scope, 6-week timeline, success metrics, and commercial terms for design partners.
Acceptance Criteria: Pilot offer deck and statement-of-work template are approved and ready for outreach

Summary: Launch founder-led outbound and content engine
Description: Run weekly outbound cadence plus technical content showcasing first verified transaction use cases.
Acceptance Criteria: Outbound cadence produces minimum SQL target and content calendar ships weekly

Description: Execute technical onboarding playbook from sandbox account setup to first paid verified run.
Acceptance Criteria: Pilot accounts complete onboarding milestones and record first value event within 14 days

Description: Create conversion criteria and close plan to move successful pilots into paid annual subscriptions.
Acceptance Criteria: Pilot conversion process yields signed annual contracts at or above target close rate

Description: Add second provider adapter and failover routing to reduce single-rail dependency.
Acceptance Criteria: Transactions can route across two providers with deterministic operation normalization

Description: Auto-route mismatch classes to finance queues with policy-driven resolution hints.
Acceptance Criteria: Mismatch routing assigns queue and reason code deterministically

Description: Partition netting windows for high-volume tenants to control contention and latency.
Acceptance Criteria: Netting partitioning reduces lock contention while preserving ledger invariants

Description: Provide what-if simulation endpoints for treasury teams before net close execution.
Acceptance Criteria: Simulation API returns reproducible net-outcome projections for fixed input sets

Description: Enforce arbitration timers, escalation windows, and breach alerts by tenant policy.
Acceptance Criteria: Arbitration SLA timers trigger expected escalation events in tests

Description: Allow teams to run historical replay against draft policies before promotion.
Acceptance Criteria: Policy simulation replays historical runs and reports deterministic diffs

Summary: Add org role packs and approval chains
Description: Prebuilt org role templates and multi-step approval chains for policy and key operations.
Acceptance Criteria: Role packs and approval chains enforce permissions and produce audit records

Description: Add discovery, trust signals, and compatibility metadata UI for certified plugins.
Acceptance Criteria: Catalog UI lists certified plugins with version and compatibility filters

Description: Support revenue-share accounting and payout statements for plugin developers.
Acceptance Criteria: Plugin usage is metered and revenue-share payouts are generated per period

Description: Expose tenant policy controls that define disclosure levels by counterpart and workflow.
Acceptance Criteria: Disclosure policy rules are enforced during proof generation and verification

Description: Enable active-passive multi-region failover for API and critical workers.
Acceptance Criteria: Failover drills demonstrate RTO/RPO targets across regions

Summary: Scale throughput benchmark to release+3 target
Description: Re-benchmark system at 3x Release 1 target load and identify bottleneck remediations.
Acceptance Criteria: Throughput benchmark report includes achieved capacity and prioritized fixes

Description: Ship SDK helpers for policy governance, delegation, and audit export operations.
Acceptance Criteria: SDK toolkit supports admin workflows with docs and passing smoke tests

Description: Create certification checklist and test harness for implementation partners.
Acceptance Criteria: Partner certification harness validates required integration behaviors

Summary: Introduce annual prepay and volume discounts
Description: Add billing support for annual contracts and pre-negotiated volume discount schedules.
Acceptance Criteria: Billing engine applies annual and volume pricing correctly on generated invoices

Description: Automate pipeline-to-revenue forecasting using pilot conversion and usage expansion signals.
Acceptance Criteria: Forecast report updates weekly with scenario bands and driver assumptions

Summary: Expand outbound engine to channel partners
Description: Create partner referral motion with co-sell collateral and integration incentives.
Acceptance Criteria: At least three active channel partners enter referral pipeline

Summary: Publish vertical playbooks for top two ICPs
Description: Create repeatable sales and onboarding playbooks by vertical with ROI narratives.
Acceptance Criteria: Playbooks are used in live deals and improve cycle progression metrics

Summary: Run expansion campaigns on converted pilots
Description: Drive seat, volume, and module expansion for converted pilot customers.
Acceptance Criteria: Expansion campaign yields targeted upsell pipeline and closed expansion revenue

Description: Codify MEDDICC-style enterprise process, stage definitions, and inspection cadence for scale.
Acceptance Criteria: Enterprise process is documented and adopted in weekly deal reviews

Summary: Enable production money-rail operations and reconciliation
Description: Promote payout and collection adapters from sandbox to production mode with deterministic operation-state mapping and reconciled finance journals.
Acceptance Criteria: Production provider transactions reconcile daily with zero unresolved critical mismatches over 5 consecutive days

Summary: Ship escrow net-close with treasury-safe invariants
Description: Finalize escrow net-close execution path, including close proofs, fail-safe unwind, and deterministic treasury snapshots.
Acceptance Criteria: Net-close runs conserve balances exactly and produce replay-identical close artifacts across repeated runs

Summary: Launch full arbitration workflow with appeals evidence binding
Description: Implement arbiter panel assignment, verdict artifact signing, appeal submission windows, and deterministic finality transitions.
Acceptance Criteria: Arbitration workflows enforce valid appeal windows and all verdict or appeal artifacts verify signature and evidence linkage

Summary: Ship delegation chain observability and emergency revoke UX
Description: Add end-to-end chain-of-authority trace views and one-click emergency key or delegation revocation workflows.
Acceptance Criteria: Operators can inspect full delegation chains and revoke compromised authority in under 60 seconds with audited events

Summary: Graduate plugin sandbox and certification to GA
Description: Harden plugin sandbox limits, signing enforcement, and certification pipeline for production-certified verifier plugins.
Acceptance Criteria: Certified plugins run in sandbox with enforced quotas and all unsigned or incompatible plugins are blocked at install time

Summary: Implement selective-disclosure evidence packs for disputes
Description: Extend selective-disclosure proofs so dispute and arbitration workflows can share minimum-required evidence while preserving integrity checks.
Acceptance Criteria: Dispute evidence exports pass verification when minimally disclosed and fail if any disclosed fields are tampered

Description: Run integrated load tests across verification, escrow, rails, and disputes at 10x current production-ready target with incident rehearsal.
Acceptance Criteria: System sustains target load with p95 latency and error-rate within SLO budgets and no unresolved Sev1 incidents

Description: Ship production-grade reference integrations for agent-agent, agent-human, and agent-robot verified transaction loops.
Acceptance Criteria: Three reference apps run end-to-end in CI and each completes identity, terms, proof, verification, and settlement flows

Description: Add pricing and billing logic for transaction-fee capture on settled volume with auditable per-transaction fee records.
Acceptance Criteria: Invoice artifacts include deterministic transaction-fee line items that reconcile exactly to settlement ledger events

Summary: Close first three lighthouse production customers
Description: Run launch motion to convert qualified pilots into production contracts with defined go-live and expansion plans.
Acceptance Criteria: Three customers sign production agreements and each executes at least one paid verified transaction in production

Summary: Stand up network command center dashboards
Description: Unify reliability, trust, treasury, and revenue metrics into one operating command center for daily launch operations.
Acceptance Criteria: Daily command center dashboard reports load, determinism, settlement volume, dispute SLA, and revenue metrics with <15 minute freshness

Summary: Run S13 go-live gate and launch cutover
Description: Execute launch checklist, rollback rehearsal, compliance signoff, and production cutover for autonomous network activation.
Acceptance Criteria: Launch gate passes determinism, reliability, security, and commercial readiness checks and production cutover completes without rollback
